resources.string: 1. The files in a file system have mandatory attributes like: size and name(s), and non-essential metadata like modification date/time, creation date/time, (last) access date/time
2. The file that keeps track of all files on an NTFS file system has the name
3. The modification date/time, creation date/time, access date/time when copying/moving a file from a file system to another depends on the following factors:
whether the computer is in hibernation
4. The file signature of a DOCX file is
identical to the one of a ZIP file
5. Starting with which version of Windows, implicitly, the last access date/time is not updated on NTFS
6. Rockridge ISO file system extension is used for CDs to allow the following feature:
7. A 32bit CPU/Operating system without PAE (Physical Address Extension) allows the programs access less than
8. The master boot record has the last bytes (signature):
9. Two different files (containing different data) can have the same MD5 signature
true because they reside in different folders
true because the MD5 is a bijective function
false because it\'s impossible to generate two or more different files having different content, yet producing the same MD5 checksum
10. A file that has become too large to be kept as a resident in an MFT record can be made resident again by truncating the file to a certain number of bytes.

I find your lack of faith disturbing!

Let me see you with my own eyes!
%d questions answered correctly out of 10\nResult: It\'s a pass!
%d questions answered correctly out of 10\nResult: Failed!

Do not press the submit button until you have answered all the questions.
The test consists of 10 questions.
Every question is worth 1 point.
In order to pass, one should obtain 7 or more points.
Each question has a correct answer, if you do not answer a question, you get zero points for that question.
Any question which uses radio buttons allows only one answer.
There are questions that have multiple answers, those are marked by checkboxes. In that case: answering a wrong answer, will not get you the point; answering only some (not all) of the correct answers will not get you partial points.
There is a question where you have to type in the response.

May the Force be with you!
